solution:
To connect to the company Wi-Fi:
1. Click the Wi-Fi icon in your system tray
2. Look for 'CompanyWiFi' or 'CompanyGuest'
3. Enter your employee credentials (same as your email login)
4. If prompted for a certificate, click 'Trust' or 'Accept'
5. You should be connected automatically after first setup

Troubleshooting:
- If you can't see the network, make sure Wi-Fi is enabled
- Try forgetting the network and reconnecting
- Restart your device if issues persist

To set up VPN access:
1. Download Cisco AnyConnect from the IT Portal
2. Install the application
3. Open Cisco AnyConnect
4. Enter VPN address: vpn.company.com
5. Use your employee credentials to login
6. Accept the multi-factor authentication prompt

For remote work, always connect to VPN before accessing internal resources.

To reset your password:
1. Visit https://portal.company.com/reset
2. Enter your employee email address
3. Click 'Forgot Password'
4. Check your email for a reset link (valid for 1 hour)
5. Create a new password meeting these requirements:
   - At least 12 characters
   - Mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols
   - Cannot reuse last 5 passwords

If you don't receive the email within 5 minutes, check your spam folder or contact IT at x5555.

If your account is locked:
1. Wait 30 minutes for automatic unlock (after 5 failed attempts)
2. OR call IT Support immediately at x5555 for manual unlock
3. Once unlocked, reset your password if you've forgotten it

Prevent lockouts:
- Don't share your password
- Use password manager
- Update saved passwords on all devices after changing
keywords: locked,account locked,locked out,access denied,too many attempts

solution:
To install Microsoft Teams:
1. Visit the IT Portal (portal.company.com)
2. Navigate to 'Software' > 'Approved Applications'
3. Click 'Microsoft Teams' and download
4. Run the installer
5. Sign in with your company email
6. Teams will sync your contacts and channels automatically

For issues:
- Ensure you have admin rights (or request installation via IT Portal)
- Clear old versions before installing
- Restart after installation

To activate Microsoft Office:
1. Open any Office application (Word, Excel, etc.)
2. Click 'Sign In' in the top right
3. Use your company email address
4. Complete multi-factor authentication
5. Office will activate automatically

If activation fails:
- Check internet connection
- Sign out and sign back in
- Contact IT if you see 'Product Unlicensed'

If Zoom audio isn't working:
1. Click the microphone icon in Zoom - ensure it's not muted
2. Click the arrow next to microphone and select correct device
3. Go to Settings > Audio and test your speaker/microphone
4. Check system sound settings:
   - Windows: Right-click speaker icon > Open Sound Settings
   - Mac: System Preferences > Sound
5. Ensure Zoom has microphone permissions
6. Restart Zoom
7. Restart your computer if issues persist

Common causes:
- Hardware muted (check physical mute button on headset)
- Wrong input/output device selected
- Driver issues (update audio drivers)

If your camera isn't detected:
1. Check if camera is physically connected (external cameras)
2. Look for camera indicator light
3. Verify camera permissions:
   - Windows: Settings > Privacy > Camera
   - Mac: System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Camera
4. Enable camera access for your application (Zoom, Teams, etc.)
5. Update camera drivers:
   - Windows: Device Manager > Cameras > Update Driver
   - Mac: Update macOS
6. Try different USB port (for external cameras)
7. Restart your device

If still not working, the camera may be in use by another application.

To connect to a projector:
1. Connect HDMI or DisplayPort cable to your laptop
2. The display should appear automatically
3. If not, press Windows+P (Windows) or Cmd+F1 (Mac)
4. Select display mode:
   - Duplicate: Same content on both screens
   - Extend: Use projector as second monitor
5. Adjust resolution if needed in Display Settings

For wireless projection:
1. Connect to meeting room Wi-Fi
2. Open the room's casting app (AirPlay, Miracast, or custom system)
3. Select the room name
4. Enter PIN if required (usually displayed on projector)

Issue: 'No Signal'?
- Check cable connections
- Try different cable or port
- Restart laptop while connected

If screen sharing isn't working:
1. Close and restart the video conferencing app
2. Check app permissions:
   - Mac: System Preferences > Security > Screen Recording
   - Windows: Usually no permission needed
3. In Zoom/Teams, click 'Share Screen'
4. Select the window or entire screen
5. Ensure 'Share computer sound' is checked if needed

Common issues:
- Black screen: Enable screen recording permissions
- Lag: Close unnecessary apps, check internet speed
- Participants can't see: Re-share or restart meeting

If printer isn't detected:
1. Ensure printer is on and connected to network
2. Check printer display for errors
3. For network printers:
   - Visit \\printserver\printers (Windows) or use Printer Setup (Mac)
   - Find your department's printer
   - Right-click and 'Connect'
4. For USB printers:
   - Reconnect USB cable
   - Install drivers from IT Portal
5. Restart Print Spooler service (Windows):
   - Press Win+R, type 'services.msc'
   - Find 'Print Spooler', right-click, Restart
6. Clear print queue if stuck

Contact IT for printer name/location if unsure.

For keyboard/mouse problems:
1. Check physical connection (USB, wireless receiver)
2. Try different USB port
3. For wireless devices:
   - Replace batteries
   - Re-pair device using pairing button
4. Check Device Manager (Windows) for driver issues
5. Test with another device to rule out hardware failure
6. Clean keyboard/mouse (especially for stuck keys)
7. Restart computer

If company-issued equipment is defective, submit hardware replacement request via IT Portal.

If your laptop is overheating:
1. Ensure air vents aren't blocked
2. Use laptop on hard, flat surface (not on bed/couch)
3. Clean vents with compressed air
4. Close unnecessary applications
5. Check Task Manager/Activity Monitor for high CPU usage
6. Update operating system and drivers
7. Consider using laptop cooling pad

Warning signs:
- Fan running loudly constantly
- Hot to touch
- Unexpected shutdowns
- Performance throttling

If issues persist, request hardware diagnostic via IT Portal.

If Outlook isn't syncing:
1. Check internet connection
2. Click 'Send/Receive' button manually
3. Go to File > Account Settings > Account Settings
4. Select your email account and click 'Repair'
5. Restart Outlook
6. Check if you're in Offline Mode (look for 'Working Offline' in status bar)
7. Clear Outlook cache:
   - Close Outlook
   - Delete *.ost file from %localappdata%\Microsoft\Outlook
   - Restart Outlook (will rebuild)

For persistent issues, verify email quota isn't full.

Managing spam and blocked emails:
1. Check Junk Email folder in Outlook
2. If legitimate email is marked as spam:
   - Right-click message > Junk > Not Junk
   - Add sender to Safe Senders list
3. To report spam:
   - Select message
   - Click 'Report' > 'Phishing' or 'Junk'
4. Set up inbox rules:
   - File > Manage Rules & Alerts
   - Create custom filters

Never click links in suspicious emails. Forward phishing attempts to security@company.com.

Browser problems (Chrome, Edge, Firefox):
1. Clear cache and cookies:
   - Chrome: Ctrl+Shift+Delete > Clear browsing data
   - Choose 'All time' and select all options
2. Disable extensions temporarily
3. Update browser to latest version
4. Reset browser settings
5. Try incognito/private mode
6. Check for malware with company antivirus
7. Reinstall browser if needed

Common issues:
- Pages not loading: Check internet, clear DNS cache
- Slow performance: Too many tabs/extensions
- Certificate errors: Check system date/time

Managing antivirus (McAfee/Symantec):
1. Antivirus updates automatically via IT
2. If you see update prompts, click 'Update Now'
3. Don't disable antivirus without IT approval
4. If scan is slowing your computer:
   - Schedule scans during lunch or end of day
   - Right-click antivirus icon > Settings > Schedule
5. Report suspected viruses immediately:
   - Quarantine suspicious files
   - Contact IT Security at security@company.com

Never install personal antivirus software on company devices.

If your security badge isn't working:
1. Ensure badge is not damaged or demagnetized
2. Hold badge flat against reader (not in wallet)
3. Try cleaning badge with soft cloth
4. Verify badge hasn't expired (check date on badge)
5. Report lost/stolen badges immediately to Security
6. Request replacement via IT Portal > Hardware > Access Badge

Temporary access: Contact Security front desk for day pass.

Accessing shared drives:
1. Open File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac)
2. Map network drive:
   - Windows: Right-click 'This PC' > Map Network Drive
   - Enter: \\fileserver\department
   - Use your company credentials
   - Check 'Reconnect at login'
3. For Mac:
   - Finder > Go > Connect to Server
   - Enter: smb://fileserver/department
4. Bookmark frequently used shares

If you get 'Access Denied':
- Verify you have permissions for that folder
- Request access via IT Portal > Access Requests
- Provide manager approval for sensitive folders

Setting up email on smartphone:

iPhone:
1. Settings > Mail > Accounts > Add Account
2. Select 'Exchange'
3. Enter your company email
4. Server: mail.company.com
5. Complete authentication
6. Choose what to sync (mail, contacts, calendar)

Android:
1. Settings > Accounts > Add Account
2. Select 'Exchange' or 'Corporate'
3. Enter email: yourname@company.com
4. Server: mail.company.com
5. Accept security policies
6. Choose sync settings

Note: Company security policies will be enforced (PIN required, remote wipe capability).

Setting up VPN on mobile:

iPhone:
1. Download 'Cisco AnyConnect' from App Store
2. Open app
3. Enter: vpn.company.com
4. Login with company credentials
5. Accept VPN profile installation
6. Toggle VPN on when needed

Android:
1. Download 'Cisco AnyConnect' from Play Store
2. Open app
3. Add new connection: vpn.company.com
4. Login with credentials
5. Accept connection request
6. Enable when accessing company resources

VPN required for:
- Accessing internal websites remotely
- Checking sensitive company data
- Using company apps from home

New employee IT setup checklist:

Week 1:
✓ Receive laptop and peripherals from IT
✓ Activate employee account (check email for instructions)
✓ Set up multi-factor authentication
✓ Complete security awareness training
✓ Install required software (Teams, Office, VPN)
✓ Configure email on mobile device
✓ Connect to company Wi-Fi
✓ Map shared department drives

Week 2:
✓ Request access to specific tools/systems
✓ Join team channels in Teams/Slack
✓ Schedule 1:1 with IT for any questions
✓ Bookmark IT Portal and support resources

All setup guides available at: portal.company.com/new-hire

Cybersecurity best practices:

1. Password Security:
   - Use unique passwords for each account
   - Enable multi-factor authentication
   - Use company password manager
   - Never share passwords

2. Email Safety:
   - Verify sender before clicking links
   - Don't open unexpected attachments
   - Look for phishing red flags (urgency, typos)
   - Report suspicious emails to security@company.com

3. Device Security:
   - Lock screen when away from desk (Win+L or Ctrl+Cmd+Q)
   - Don't leave devices unattended
   - Report lost/stolen devices immediately
   - Only install approved software

4. Data Protection:
   - Don't share confidential info externally
   - Use company file sharing (not personal Dropbox)
   - Encrypt sensitive files
   - Follow clean desk policy

Complete mandatory training at: training.company.com

Setting up Slack:

1. Check email for Slack workspace invitation
2. Click 'Join Now'
3. Create password or use SSO (Single Sign-On)
4. Download Slack desktop app from IT Portal
5. Install and sign in
6. Join your team channels:
   - #general (company-wide)
   - #it-support (for tech help)
   - Your department channels
7. Set up notifications:
   - Preferences > Notifications
   - Customize Do Not Disturb hours
8. Add profile photo and update status

Slack etiquette:
- Use threads for discussions
- @mention sparingly
- Use #it-support for tech issues, not DMs

How to contact IT Support:

1. Self-Service Portal (Fastest):
   - portal.company.com
   - Submit tickets, download software, request access
   - Check ticket status

2. IT Helpdesk:
   - Phone: x5555 (internal) or 555-123-5555 (external)
   - Hours: Monday-Friday, 7AM-7PM
   - 24/7 emergency line: 555-123-5599

3. Email:
   - itsupport@company.com
   - Response within 4 business hours

4. Slack:
   - #it-support channel for quick questions

5. Walk-up Support:
   - IT Desk, Building A, 1st Floor
   - Hours: Monday-Friday, 8AM-5PM

Priority levels:
- P1 (Critical): System down, security breach - Call immediately
- P2 (High): Can't work, access issues - Submit ticket + Slack
- P3 (Medium): Inconvenience, software request - Submit ticket
- P4 (Low): Questions, how-to - Self-service or email

Requesting new software:

1. Check approved software list:
   - portal.company.com > Software Catalog
   - Many apps available for self-install

2. For unlisted software:
   - Submit request via IT Portal
   - Provide business justification
   - Include software name, vendor, purpose
   - Await manager approval

3. Approval process:
   - Manager approval (1-2 days)
   - Security review (3-5 days)
   - License procurement if needed (varies)
   - Installation or access granted

4. Open source/free tools:
   - Still require security review
   - Submit request with download link

Never install unauthorized software - violates security policy.

Requesting hardware:

1. Standard equipment (auto-approved):
   - Mouse, keyboard, monitor, headset
   - Submit via IT Portal > Hardware Requests
   - Usually fulfilled within 3 business days

2. Specialized equipment (requires approval):
   - Additional monitors (3+)
   - Docking stations
   - Upgraded laptop specs
   - External storage
   - Manager approval required

3. Mobile devices:
   - Smartphones, tablets
   - Complete mobile device request form
   - VP approval required
   - Monthly service fees apply

4. Replacements:
   - Defective equipment: Immediate replacement
   - Upgrades: Every 3-4 years per IT lifecycle policy
   - Return old equipment to IT

All hardware remains company property.

If your computer is running slow:

1. Immediate fixes:
   - Close unused applications
   - Restart computer (if not done in >5 days)
   - Check Task Manager/Activity Monitor for high CPU/memory usage
   - Disable startup programs

2. Disk space:
   - Check available storage (need >20% free)
   - Delete unnecessary files
   - Empty Recycle Bin/Trash
   - Move large files to shared drives

3. Updates:
   - Install pending OS updates
   - Update drivers (especially graphics)
   - Update applications

4. Maintenance:
   - Run disk cleanup (Windows)
   - Defragment hard drive (HDD only, not SSD)
   - Scan for malware with company antivirus

5. Still slow?
   - Request IT diagnostic scan
   - May need hardware upgrade (RAM, SSD)
   - Consider laptop refresh if >4 years old

Troubleshooting slow internet:

1. Speed test:
   - Visit speedtest.net
   - Company internet should be >100 Mbps download
   - Run test 2-3 times

2. Basic checks:
   - Are others experiencing same issue?
   - Restart your computer
   - Disconnect from VPN temporarily (test local connection)
   - Try ethernet cable instead of Wi-Fi

3. Wi-Fi specific:
   - Move closer to access point
   - Check signal strength (should be >-70 dBm)
   - Switch to 5GHz network if available
   - Restart Wi-Fi adapter

4. Network congestion:
   - Slow during specific times (lunch, meetings)?
   - Close bandwidth-heavy apps (streaming, large downloads)
   - Pause cloud sync temporarily

5. Report issues:
   - If affecting multiple people: Contact IT immediately
   - Provide: location, time, speed test results
   - IT will check network infrastructure

Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) / Kernel Panic:

1. Immediate action:
   - Take photo of error code if possible
   - Let computer restart automatically
   - Note what you were doing when it occurred

2. One-time occurrence:
   - Usually not serious (random glitch)
   - Continue working normally
   - Monitor for recurrence

3. Frequent BSODs:
   - Document error codes
   - Note frequency and triggers
   - Contact IT immediately
   - May indicate:
     * Driver issues
     * Hardware failure (RAM, hard drive)
     * Software conflicts

4. Prevention:
   - Keep system updated
   - Don't force shutdown regularly
   - Save work frequently
   - Enable AutoSave in Office apps

5. Data backup:
   - Ensure important files are on shared drives or OneDrive
   - Hardware failure can cause data loss

Severe or frequent crashes require immediate IT intervention.

Mac basics for Windows users:

1. Key differences:
   - Cmd key = Windows key
   - Cmd+C/V = Copy/Paste (not Ctrl)
   - Cmd+Q = Quit application (not just close window)
   - Cmd+Space = Spotlight search (like Windows search)
   - Finder = File Explorer

2. Common shortcuts:
   - Cmd+Tab: Switch apps
   - Cmd+`: Switch windows within app
   - Cmd+Shift+3: Screenshot
   - Cmd+Comma: Preferences/Settings
   - Cmd+Delete: Move to Trash

3. Useful features:
   - Mission Control (F3): View all windows
   - Launchpad (F4): View all apps
   - Hot Corners: Customize in System Preferences

4. System Preferences:
   - Apple menu > System Preferences
   - Equivalent to Windows Settings
   - Customize trackpad, keyboard, etc.

5. Installing apps:
   - App Store
   - IT Portal for work apps
   - Drag .app files to Applications folder

Resources: IT Portal > Mac User Guide

Remote work IT checklist:

1. Before leaving office:
   - Ensure laptop is fully charged
   - Bring power adapter and peripherals
   - Test VPN connection
   - Download any needed files

2. Home setup:
   - Reliable internet (>25 Mbps recommended)
   - Quiet workspace
   - External monitor optional but helpful
   - Ethernet connection preferred over Wi-Fi

3. Connectivity:
   - Connect to VPN before accessing company resources
   - Keep VPN on during work hours
   - Use company Wi-Fi calling app for phone system

4. Security:
   - Don't use public/coffee shop Wi-Fi for company work
   - Lock screen when away
   - Use privacy screen if working in public
   - Secure physical workspace from family/roommates

5. Communication:
   - Update Slack/Teams status to 'Remote'
   - Join meetings 5 min early to test audio/video
   - Keep phone charged for alternative contact

6. Issues while remote:
   - Contact IT via phone or personal device
   - Have backup plan (mobile hotspot)

Policy: portal.company.com/remote-work-policy
keywords: remote work,work from home,wfh,remote,home office,vpn,remote access,telework

solution:
Using OneDrive for file backup:

1. Setup:
   - OneDrive pre-configured on company laptops
   - Sign in with company email
   - Look for blue cloud icon in system tray

2. What to sync:
   - Desktop, Documents, Pictures folders (automatic)
   - Important work files
   - DO NOT sync: large media files, personal files

3. How it works:
   - Files save to local computer AND cloud
   - Access from any device at onedrive.company.com
   - Automatic versioning (restore previous versions)
   - 1TB storage quota per user

4. Selective sync:
   - Right-click OneDrive icon
   - Settings > Account > Choose folders
   - Select what to sync locally

5. Troubleshooting:
   - Not syncing: Check icon for errors
   - Pause and resume sync
   - Verify internet connection
   - Ensure storage quota not exceeded

6. Sharing files:
   - Right-click file > Share
   - Set permissions (view/edit)
   - Share with company users only

Critical: OneDrive is your backup. Save important files there!

Using conference room technology:

1. Before meeting:
   - Book room via Outlook calendar
   - Arrive 5 min early for setup
   - Check room name matches booking

2. Connecting laptop:
   - Wired: HDMI/DisplayPort cable on table
   - Wireless: Use room's AirPlay/Miracast
   - Follow on-screen instructions

3. Video conferencing:
   - Use room's Zoom/Teams system
   - Or connect your laptop and use room camera/mic
   - Room calendar may have one-touch join button

4. Audio setup:
   - Speakerphone in center of table
   - Press unmute button
   - Adjust volume with +/- buttons
   - Mute when not speaking (large groups)

5. Ending meeting:
   - Disconnect your devices
   - Leave room as you found it
   - End video call on room system

6. Issues:
   - Red light on equipment: Already in use or error
   - 'No signal': Check cable connections
   - Can't hear: Check volume and mute status
   - Can't join video call: Verify room system is on

For technical difficulties during meeting: Call IT x5555
keywords: conference room,meeting room,zoom room,teams room,projector,video conferencing,booking
